column7: Reference reach (if "Reference", ref. reach; if name of reach, that reach is ref. reach for this row)
column29: If temporary upstream unaffected, year of affected
column30: Transect begins upstream of mining tributary junction
column32: River km of tributary junction exact
column33: If transect at tributary is secondary
column35: Notes
Formal diamond mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Major expansion with several new mines and likely some informal/exploratory activity in mid-2000s and 2010s.
Minor mostly informal mining area. Presumably primarily or exclusively for diamonds.
Major mostly formal diamond mining with long history. Mining present at beginning of Landsat record. Steady expansion.
Formal diamond mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Major expansion with several new mines and likely some informal/exploratory activity in mid-2000s and 2010s.
Major diamond mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Major expansion during the 2000s.
Major diamond mines. Present at beginning of Landsat record.
Formal diamond mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Major expansion with several new mines and likely some informal/exploratory activity in mid-2000s and 2010s.
Small diamond mining area. Begins in 2000. Seems to be sporadically active.
Small mining area in mountainous area. Tributaries are too small to map.
Small mining area in mountainous area. Tributaries are too small to map.
Major mining area mostly along main stem of river in narrow valley. Begins in 2010s and expands rapidly.
Major mining area mostly along a tributary. Begins in mid-2000s, but poor imagery. Major expansion in 2010s.

Intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Major expansion in late 2010s.
Small miningarea with long history. Begins in late 1980s. Active through 1990s. Inactive during 2000s. Some new activity in 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Active in late 2010s.

Major mining area with long and complicated history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Abruptly abandoned in early 1990s, seemingly 1995, due to enforcement action. Mining appears to resume after long hiatus in 2012, with rapid expansion in mid-2010s and explosion in late 2010s early 2020s.

Mining area with long and complicated history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Abruptly abandoned in early 1990s, seemingly 1995, due to enforcement action. Mining appears to resume after long hiatus in 2015, with rapid expansion in mid-2010s and explosion in late 2010s early 2020s.
Small mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. High activity in 1980s and 1990s. Seemingly abandoned in 2000s. New activity and possible minor expansion in 2010s.

Small mining area. Mining begins in late 1980s, just after beginning of Landsat record. High activity in 1980s and early 1990s. Seemingly abandoned in 2000s. Remining of area begins around 2012 continues to 2022.
Small mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. High activity in 1980s and 1990s. Seemingly abandoned in 2000s. Major remining activities begin in 2014.
Large intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Expansion in late 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Active in late 2010s.
Small intense mining area with long history. Begins sharply in late 1980s. Persists to present.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Expansion in late 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Expansion in late 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Expansion in late 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Expansion in late 2010s.

Small intense mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s. Stasis in the 1990s. Possible abandonment in 2000s, but difficult to tell. Major expansion in late 2010s.
Small mining area with long history.
Old mining area on tiny tributaries with frequent remining. Slow expansion and contraction over the decades.
Small mining area along first-order tributary to Xingu River.
Major mining area in headwaters of Kadei River. Begins in early 2010s. Rapid expansion in late 2010s.
Small mining area along a first-order tributary of the Kadei River.
Major mining area  along main stem of Lom River. Begins in late 2000s and expands steadily. Lom River where transect begins is dammed beginning in 2015. Reservoir begins at km 144.

Major mining area in headwaters of Lom River. Begins in early 2010s and expands steadily. Major expansion to tributaries in 2016. Stream very small for mapping. Downstream Lom River where transect begins is dammed beginning in 2015. Reservoir begins at km 144.
Small mining area along several first-order tributaries of the Kadei River.
Mining begins in early 2010s. Major expansion in 2018 widens tributary and substantially increases mining footprint.

Small mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record, though there are no images from the 1990s and possibly 1980s. Not clear that there is much ongoing activity at this location.
Dispersed mining along tributary to Mambere River. Unclear origin and duration, but mining extends much of the length of the river.
Small dense mining area along Atrato River tributaries. Rapid expansion in 2010s.
Small streamside mining area. Not much presence or hydrologic impact so far.
Small intense mining area with long history. Present in first Landsat images. Abandoned in late 1990s but remining begins in late 2000s.
Mid-size mining area on several adjacent headwater tributaries. All too small to map, run directly into a reservoir that could be mapped.
Small mountain and headwater stream mining area. Not much hydrologic expression and tiny streams, so too small to map.
Small mining district on low-order streams. Begins in 2010 and expands rapidly. Mining not restriced to channel, occurs on terraces and hillsides.
Major mining area on low-order stream.
Small mining area on low-order stream.
Mining area in many tributaries upstream of main Nechi River mining area. Begins later than downstream mining districts. Begins in early 2010s and rapidly expands to all nearby tributaries.
Small mining area in first-order tributary of San Juan River.
Small mining area in headwaters of colombia_antioquia_agm_region. Too small to map but many kilometres of affected streams. Beginning in 2009.
Major mining area in very cloudy region in eastern Colombia. Rapid expansion in 2010s. Difficult imagery because of clouds.
Small mining area on small tributary stream.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in 2010s. Sparse imagery.
Mining area in many tributaries upstream of main Nechi River mining area. Begins later than downstream mining districts. Begins in late 2000s and rapidly expands.
Small dense mining area along San Juan River tributaries. Rapid expansion in 2010s.
Small dense mining area along San Juan River tributaries. Rapid expansion in 2010s.
Small dense mining area along San Juan River tributaries. Rapid expansion in 2010s.
Small dense mining area along San Juan River tributaries. Rapid expansion in 2010s.
Small mining area on low-order stream.
Small mining area on low-order stream.

Mining area tributary upstream of main Nechi River mining area. Begins later than downstream mining districts. Begins in late 2000s and rapidly expands. Last 20 km has some nearby clear lakes that may dampen the AGM signal.
Major mining area with long history. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Seemingly inactive in 2000s. Activity resumes in 2010s, especially after 2015.

Large pit mine with associated alluvial mining and seemingly at least some mining drainage and/or tailings disposal. Some presence in the area beginning in 1991, but mining expansion does not appear to occur until 2015. Some in-channel mining downstream of pit mine as well.
Very small mining area along heavily mined river. Most mining activity is upstream of this area. Mostly small mining pits in floodplains.
Small mining area along a few first-order tributaries near town of Bafwabango. Limited hydrological impact so far.
East-draining mining area with major pit and alluvial mining. Present at beginning of Landsat record.
West-draining diamond mines associated with larger Bena-Baya mining district. Begins in mid-1990s and expands steadily.
Mining area with major pit operations beginning in 2012. Some exploratory smaller pits and trenches in the floodplain and channel but mostly large pit constrution. Dam built at site in 2019.
Major headwater mining area on small stream with no mappable reaches. Major expansion through time.
Small mining area. Begins in late 2000s or early 2010s. Mostly trench mining with some pits near river.
Major mining area with long history. Increased activity beginning in 2000s. Mining extends to headwaters, especially in channel.
Small mining area. Relatively intense mining given small footprint. Mining also on some other small tributaries of this stream.
Small mining area. Relatively intense mining given small footprint. Appears to affect stream to its outlet in Lake Tanganyika.

Small mining area in headwater area. Mostly trench mining on hillsides and in gully tributaries. Begins sometime in the late 2000s and expands gradually. Operations also along river between marked point and downstream transect beginning.
Small channel mining operations along Lindi River. Begins sometime in the 2010s. Headwater operations, though small, are likely larger than this mid-stream mining.

Small informal mining operations in headwaters of Lindi River. Begins in early 2010s and continues. Mostly in channel mining. Small areal footprint so far, but hydrologic impacts evident in small (unmappable) low-order streams.

Small informal mining operations in headwaters of Lindi River. Begins in early 2010s and continues. Mostly in channel mining. Small areal footprint so far, but hydrologic impacts evident in small (unmappable) low-order streams.
Small mining area on headwater tributary. Mostly near-channel trench mining.

Major mining district. Extends upstream and at least 100 km downstream, including side tributaries. Difficult imagery makes origin difficult to identify, but mining seems to begin in mid-2000s. Major operations present in 2010. Expansion through 2010s.

Major diamond mining area. History dates to early 1900s but major expansion in 1980s and 1990s. Then some abandonment due to mismanagement and diamond prices in 2000s. Seems to have a resurgence in 2010s.
Reference river for Mbuji-Mayi and nearby diamond mines. Not affected by major diamond mining through 2021.
Major mining area on small tributary and headwater streams. Expansion during the late 1990s and early 2000s.
Small intense mining area. Recent beginning or at least major expansion, since 2010.
column36: Reference SSC high beginning early in transect. Check Mining onset and transect length.

column35: Small intense mining area with long history. Mostly trench mining. Some evidence of mining activity since the beginning of the Landsat record. Contraction after 1980s. Remining begins in 2000s. As such, start of mining date set at 2007.
Major mining area. Begins in late 2000s or early 2010s. Many dispersed mining operations in this general area. Mosly trench and channel mining.
Major mining area. Begins in late 2000s or early 2010s. Many dispersed mining operations in this general area. Mosly trench and channel mining.
Major mining area. May have origins in 1980s or 1990s, but begins in earnest in late 2000s. Particularly intensive mining in headwater section. Mining along much of the upstream reach of river.

Small intense mining area with long history. Mostly trench mining. Some evidence of mining activity since the beginning of the Landsat record. Contraction after 1980s. Remining begins in 2000s. As such, start of mining date set at 2007.
Mining area with recent expansion in 2010s. Trench mining on hillsides and pit mining near river on floodplain.
Major mining area in remote location. Mostly trench mining dispersed around the town. Possiblly some presence before 2010 but major expansion in 2010s.
Very small mining area along heavily mined river. Most mining activity is downstream of this area. Mostly trenching in slopes by river.

Major mining area along channel and in floodplain. Possibly has minor origins in 1980s, but clear evidence of mining begins in mid-1990s. Steady expansion to present. Mining extends to headwaters, especially in channel.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in mid 2010s. Sparse imagery.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in 2010s. Sparse imagery.
Mining area along the river. Main mining district along channel with minor mining areas upstream.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in mid 2010s. Sparse imagery.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in 2010s. Sparse imagery.

Major mining area with formalized operations and extensive informal operations. Very steep mountainous area, so mining is restircted to hillsides and in the channel. Very little floodplain. Difficult to establish a suitable reference period, so use lowest point in satellite record during the 2000s lull.
Tributary mining area. Mining in river channel for gold and sand. Mining in headwaters and mountaintops dating back to beginning of Landsat record.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in mid 2010s. Major road and dam building during same period. Difficult to disentangle because occurs in narrow upper reaches of river.
Small mining area. Seems to begin in late 2000s. Sparse imagery.
Small formalized mining area in remote area. Long history. Present in small form at beginning of Landsat record. Major expansion in 1990s and continued operations through 2010s.
Very small mining area on tributary to Gambia River. Sparse imagery so difficult to determine start year.
Major mining area. Begins in late 2000s. Rapidly expands.
Major mining area in small river. Begins in 2010 and rapidly expands.
Major mining area in small river. Begins in 2010 and rapidly expands.
Major mining area in small river. Begins in 2010 and rapidly expands.
Large mining operation present at beginning of Landsat record. Expands through the 1990s until 1999. Then operations contract or improve environmental footprint. Some resurgence in the 2010s.
Mining area scavenging from large sandbars during low-water season. Extensive along ~150 km of Niger River main stem until at least Bamako.
Major headwaters mining area. Almost every tributary in headwater region is mined. Began mid-2000s and major expansion since.
Small mining area downstream of major headwaters mining area.
Major mining area near mouth of Cuyuni River. Many mining districts upstream, including across the border in Venezuela. Steady expansion since mid-2000s.

Major mining area. Many small tributaries mined. None are large enough for mapping. Possibly began in 2004 or 2005. Major expansion in 2007. Tributaries contribute to Cuyuni River along lower transect.
Small mining area with one major area by river main stem. Several smaller areas on small upstream tributaries. Began in 2008 and rapidly expanded. No major change since.
Major mining area. Expansion began in early 1990s along channel. Major expansion increase in 2010s.
Long river with several mining districts along it. Downstream mining areas are much more extensive than tiny upstream operations
Small mining region along small tributaries in stream headwaters. Near Venezuela border.
Small mining area on other side of drainage divide from other Matthews Ridge site. Small mining ponds span width of channel and floodplain, not much flow during dry season.
Several mining areas along small tributaries. Began in mid-2000s. Expanded in 2010s.
Major mining area between rivers near tributary outlet. Began in 1990s, hard to tell what year exactly. Definitely in operation by 1995. Major expansion in 2008. Major expansion in 2010s.
Major tributary river mining area. Expansion beginning in late 1990s. Major recent expansion in 2010s.
Stream channel mining on narrow stream, upper section.
Stream channel mining on narrow stream, lower section.
Small operations along and in river. First tributary with indonesia Tutut AGM region began ~2016. Second tributary to the west began 2020-2021.
Mining district on tributary to Batang Hari River tributary. Begins in early 2000s. Rapid expansion.
Small intense mining area along tributary of stream.
Mining district in headwaters of Batang Hari River. Begins in early 2010s. Expands rapidly along stream channels in tributary network.
Small intense mining area along tributary of stream. Seems to be at least partially abandoned in 2010s.

Small mining district near major mined tributary (batang_hari_trib3). Mining areas on both north and south side of river. South side begins first in 2002. North side begins in 2012. North side seems relatively short lived. South side more persistent, but may have some abandonment in late 2010s.
Mining district on tributary to Batang Hari River. Begins in early 2000s. Rapid expansion along multiple small tributaries.
Several mining districts along river and in tributaries. Steady expansion since 2000.

Mining presence small in 1990s. Major expansion in 2000s. Major expansion in 2010s. Many short tributaries mined, contributing to many more river kms unmapped but affected. Signficant conversion of palm oil plantations to mining pits.
Mining presence small in 1990s. Expanded mining in 2000s. Major expansion in 2010s, especially on tributary. Many short tributaries mined, contributing to many more river kms unmapped but affected.
Steady expansion of mining since 1990s. Many short tributaries mined, contributing to many more river kms unmapped but affected.
Small river with steadily increasing mining operations. Mostly along river.
Small mining operation near headwaters. Begins much later than downstream operations.
Headwater mining area. Near drainage divide. Very poor imagery. Difficult to assess beginning of mining.
Mining district along length of tributary to Batang Hari River. Begins in mid-2000s and rapidly expands to full length of tributary.
Mining near major palm oil plantation along small tributary to small river. Begins in 2000s. Expansion in 2010s.
Headwaters mining district for Inderagiri River. Several mining operations around, including pit mining that begins before Landsat record. Mining operations expand in 2010s.
Mining district along Inderagiri River. Begins in mid-2000s and rapidly expands. Small tributary empties into Inderagiri.
Begins in late 2000s and early 2010s. Rapid expansion then possible abandonment in late 2010s.
Streamside mining area.
Small mining area. Significant palm oil plantations as well. Dam closed in 1996.
Mining operations begin and rapidly expand in 2021.
Mining operations begin and rapidly expand in 2015. Followed by more operations farther downstream on transect in different district in 2021.
Small coastal river with recent mining activity. Extreme deforestation in upper valley to the east in the mid-1990s and 2000s caused an initial pulse of river sedimentation.
Upstream-most of several mining districts along small river.
Major mining area. Logging and palm oil operations pre-mining. Mining begins around 2010, rapid expansion up small tributaries.
Major mining district, now legal. Ouwned by Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining (GSM), subsidiary of J Resources. Mining present since 1980s. Major mountain-top removal and alluvial work.
Major mining area. Largely along channel. Difficult to establish exact timing of early mining. Began or expanded dramatically in early 2000s. Continued to expand through 2000s.
Very small operation along a small river.
Mining district on tributary to Batang Hari River. Begins in early 2000s. Rapid expansion along multiple small tributaries.
Small explosion of mining ponds at edge of palm oil plantations in late 2010s. Not large enough to map. Small tributary to relatively small river.
Channel mining area. Along much of the length of river. Dispersed operations. Often associated and/or adjacent to Palm oil plantations.
Operations begin and rapidly expand in 2010s. Significant palm oil as well.
Mining begins in 2010s. Small headwater mining operation. Mountain-top and mountain-side removal near drainage divide. Some streamside and stream channel mining farther downstream.
Downstream-most of several mining districts along small river.
Mining district in several tributaries. Begins slowly in 2000. Rapid expansion in late 2000s.
Mining begins in 2019 and expands rapidly.
Small mining district in headwaters of river. Began in late 1990s and has expanded only slightly since.
Longstanding mining area. Rapid expansion in 2010s
Small river with major mining area. Major increase in 2000s.
Mining area along length of river. Begins in downstream reaches. Extends upstream in mid-1990s. Continues to expand through period of record.
Major expansion of mining in 2010s.Major palm oil on tributary with ~50% of drainage area at transect beginning.
Longstanding mining area. Rapid expansion in 2010s. Multiple small upstream tributaries affected but too small to map.
Small tributary off of main stem of river.
Mining area in tributary river and on floodplain. Major activity and increase since early 2000s.
On complicated braided system. Many different sediment inputs.

Mining area with mining beginning in early 2010s. Rapid period of expansion. Abandoned due to intervention in 2014. Mining seems to continue in late 2010s. Meets junction with another mined tributary at 79 km. That tributary is dammed beginning in 2015, reducing sediment fluxes and presumably discharge during some seasons.

Road built to area just prior to mining. Major pit mining in area as well. Dam in middle of transect completed 2015. Road built to area just prior to mining. Major pit mining in area as well. Dam in middle of transect completed 2015.
Small mining area. Begins in 2010s. Never intensively mined except for along small main channel. Mining is primarily along second-order reaches of stream and its headwater tributaries.
Small mining area. Begins in late 2010s with rapid expansion. Cestos River appears to have other land use impacts, possibly other mining upstream of this site.
Very small mining operation associated with small pit mine. On very small tributary. No major hydrologic effects evident.
Small mining area. Begins in 2010s. Slow start but rapid expansion after 2015. Along second-order reaches of stream and its headwater tributaries.
Small pit mine near river, with drainage to river. Begins in early 2000s and appears to be abandoned by late 2010s.
Small mining area in single small tributary. Begins in early 2010s.
Small riverside pit with far-reaching effects. Arid region. Abundant sediment around. Large tailings pile avalanching into river.
Small mining area with major river reconfiguration. Arid headwaters of small stream. Mining begins in early 2000s.
Small mining area in heavily altered landscape. Other major gold mines (pit mining). Logging, Palm oil, Nurseries.
Small mining area with major pit operations in addition to alluvial dredging and floodplain work. Begins in 2004 but alluvial operations her and upstream do not begin until 2010s.
Small channel mining operation on upper Faleme River and nearby floodplains. Operations begin in 2015.
Small channel mining operation on small tributary to Faleme River. Operations begin in 2015.

Small channel mining operation on Faleme River. Possibly mostly done by a single dredge. Operations begin in 2015. Significant channel modification but largely restricted to within the original channel bounds.

Small mining region in dry channel and floodplain area in small tributary to Niger River. Begins in 2013 and expands rapidly in this and adjacent tributary area. Also extensive mining along sandbars in Niger main stem near tribary confluence.
Small operations in a cold region. Sporadic mining along different reaches since 1980s.

Major mining area with long history. Begins in early 1990s with modest expansion in 1990s. Rapid expansion in early 2000s. Second major expansion up nearby tributaries in 2010s. One of few arid-land alluvial mining areas.
Small mining area with major effect on low-discharge Buzi River. Begins in 2004 and expands gradually. Hillside and gully mining predominate over channel mining.
Intense local mining area with several mines around town of Manica, Mozambique. In general, water flows to dammed lake nearby without getting to detectable widths.

Small mining area on the border of Mozambique and Zimbabwe. Stream runs through Zimbabwe then reenters Mozambique and flows to the ocean. Mining begins in early 2000s and steadily increases. Arid area with limited flow during dry season may make detection challenging.
Very small mining area. Gully mining on tiny headwaters.
Headwater stream mining area. Begins in late 1990s. Rapid increase after 2000. Tapering in late 2000s early 2010s. Late 2010s resurgence.
Transect terminates in large reservoir
Small recent mining area on tributary to Chidwin River.
Catch all transect for numerous mining districts along Chindwin River. Feeds into Irrawaddy River transect at km 653.

Major miing area on small tributary to the upper Irrawaddy River. Operations begin in some tributaries in 2000. Major expansion to all tributaries in 2000s. Mining activity appears to wane after 2014.
Major mining area. Begins small in 2008. Expands rapidly in 2010s. Extends to nearby tributary in 2010s.
Small mining area on tributary. Begins in 2013 with rapid expansion. Seemingly abandoned almost immediately in late 2010s.
Small mining area on tributary.
Small tributary mining area to lower Chidwin River. Expanded beginning in 2013.
Catch-all transect for numerous mining districts along Irrawaddy River.
Mining district in headwater streams. Feeds two slightly larger streams, but both still too small to map. Larger Mu River downstream is closest mappable section.
Small streamside mining district along long reach of tributary. Begins in late 2000s. Major expansion in early 2010s. May have some abandonment after that.
Small dense mining area in two headwater tributaries. Cannot yet detect downstream hydrologic expression. Rapid expansion in 2014 then a lull. Appears to have renewed activity in 2020.
Small mining area along Shweli River. Begins in 2008 and expands rapidly.
Major headwater mining area. Rapid expansion in early 2000s. Then abandonment in 2010s, with some exceptions where there continues to be expansion.
Small mining area along channel in mountain stream.
Intense mining area. Streams drain to nearby lake. Heavily modified channel and floodplains/terraces/mountainsides. Begins in early 2000s and expands. Rapid second expansion in 2010s.
Small mining areas along stream. Two discrete sections, one downstream where marker is, one upstream where transect begins. Begins in mid-2000s. Rapid expansion but on small footprint.
Small mining area with mining in a small drainage. Begins in late 2000s with slow expansion after.

Small intense mining area in headwater stream. Upstream-most area with intense pit mining operation. Lower operations more conventional stream mining. Begins in late 2000s and increases rapidly through mid-2010s.
Large mining area in headwaters of small tributary. Major activity since early 2010s. Flows into next tributary just upstream of combined confluence with Sittang River.
Very small tributary

Small mining area along small tributary. Tributary is dammed in late 2000s. Prior to damming, mining occurred in several headwater tributaries. Mining continues upstream of dam along main channel through 2010s.
Mining district with mining along several small tributaries. Begins in 2003 with moderate activity in 2000s. Major expansion in 2010s.
Mining area in and near channel on small tributary. Begins in mid-2000s with rapid expansion. Possible abandonmnent in late 2010s.
Major mining area along small tributary. Major expansion in 2010s but may have been present prior. Part of a larger mining district.
Small mining area in headwaters. Sprawling footprint in valley. Begins in early 2000s. Refocused and shifted during 2010s.

Small intense mining near mainstem of upland Irrawady River. Development in valley beginning in 1980s or before, but mining beins in earnest in 2000. Rapid expansion in early 2000s. Steady expansion since 2005. Possible abandonment in late 2010s.
Several small mining areas in a medium-sized tributary watershed. Appears to begin in the mid-2000s and expand afterwards.

Transect begins in dam reservoir. Initial period of high SSC possibly partially due to dam construction. Seems to have been contemporaneous AGM, so difficult to parse until after dam completed in 2010.
Small mining area along small tributary. Mining begins in early 2000s. Moderate increase in 2010s.
Mining district with mining along several small tributaries. Begins in 2002 with moderate activity in 2000s. Major expansion in 2010s.
Major mining area long several first-order tributaries to Uyu river and along Uyu River itself. Begins in mid-1990s and rapidly increases. Continues to expand through 2010s.
Major mining area on tributary. Begins sometime in the 1990s. Major expansion through the 2010s. Possible easing of activity in late 2010s.
Major minng area. Perhaps largest in Myanmar. Begins as transition from agriculture in late 1980s or early 1990s. Major mining both upstream and downstream as well.
Very small mining area with trenches and other excavation in low-sloping ground near ephemeral channels. Major rise in agriculture during 1990s and 2000s, also seems to have a sediment signal.
Small mining area. Very narrow stream. Far-reaching effects but narrow even downstream.
Intense tin mining operations in Plateau District of Nigeria. Hillside, pit, shaft, and alluvial mining all present. Relatively stable footprint for decades as mining continues.
Mining along small river. May also be sand mining. Also mining in nearby Loburo, but ot obviously connected to this hydrologic system.
Mining district in headwaters of Rio Malinowski. Begins in early 2010s and expands rapidly to become one of the most intensively mined districts in the Madre de Dios Region.
New mining area in 2020. Rapid expansion to several first-order tributaries and mining along main channel. Empties into Rio Inambari. For now, upstream-most mined tributary.
Upstream of Delta along main stem of Rio Inambari. Mining begins in early 2000s.

Major mining area with many mined tributaries and main stem mining. Mining begins in this district with completion of Interoceanic Highway in 2006-2007. Upstream mining at Huepetuhe and other areas affect transect from 1980s on. This area is part of the La Pampa district.

Mining district in La Pampa south of the Interoceanic Highway. In the protected Tambopata Preserve. Mining begins in 2011 and expands rapidly to one of the most intensively mined alluvial regions on the planet. Mining ceases abruptly in Feb. 2019 with the beginning of Operation Mercury, a Government of Peru conservation enforcemnt action. Some return to mining appears to occur in 2021.
Small mining area in protected forest. Begins in 2007 and appears to come and go through the years to present.
Alluvial mining along main stem and floodplain of Madre De Dios River. Begins in early 2000s and increases steadily.
Mining district on tributary to Rio Inambari. Mining begins in early 2000s and increases steadily.
Mining district on tributary to Rio Inambari. Mining begins in late 2000s and increases rapidly in 2010s.

Major mining area called Delta along Rio Colorado in Madre De Dios Region. Present at the beginning of Landsat record. Increases rapidly in 1980s and 1990s. Reaches an approximate steady-state of expansion in the 2000s.
Reference reach for Rio Colorado in Madre De Dios Region. Some mining bleeds into this reach in 2010s, but minimal, especially compared to Rio Colorado impacts.
Delta mining district in Madre de Dios. Present at beginning of Landsat record. Rapid expansion in 1980s and early 1990s. Then stable or slower increase for decades.
Mining district in and along the main stem channel of Rio Malinowski. Begins in the mid-2000s and does not expand much. Likely not of major regional importance.
Mining district along main stem of Rio Malinowski. Begins in mid-2000s and increases rapidly. Appears to be only partially affected by 2019 intervention Operation Mercury.
Mining district on tiny tributary to Inambari. Mining begins in early 2000s.
Operations ebb and flow throughout satellite period. Seem to wane during the mid-2000s to 2010s, then pick up again in late 2010s.
Small mining area. Begins in mid-1990s, though some presence before that. Rapid expansion until early 2000s. Then abandonment until new expansion in 2010s. May have effective containment.
Small mining area with a long history. Present at beginning of the Landsat record. Some activity in the 1990s and 2000s but also lulls. Seemingly a major uptick in activity in 2010s.
Small mining area with a long history. Present at beginning of the Landsat record. Some activity in the 1990s and 2000s but also lulls. Seemingly a major uptick in activity in 2010s.
Small mining area with a long history. Present at beginning of the Landsat record. Some activity in the 1990s and 2000s but also lulls. Seemingly a major uptick in activity in 2010s.
Small mining area with long history. Begins in late 1980s and continues intermittently through the present.
Small mining area with long history. Begins in late 1980s and continues intermittently through the present.
Small mining area with a long history. Present at beginning of the Landsat record. Some activity in the 1990s and 2000s but also lulls. Seemingly a major uptick in activity in 2010s.
Small mining area with a long history. Present at beginning of the Landsat record. Some activity in the 1990s and 2000s but also lulls. Seemingly a major uptick in activity in 2010s.
Mall mining area in first-order headwaters.
Mall mining area in first-order headwaters.
Very small mining area. Sparse imagery so difficult to determine start date. Associated with more formal pit mine.
Mining area with gold and diamond production. Headwaters of a small river. Begins in mid-2000s but stalls until mid-2010s. Major expansion in mid-2010s and late-2010s.
Mining area with rapid expansion since late 2000s.
Major mining area. Expansion began in 1990s. Expansion accelerated in 2010s.
Major mining area with many first-order tributaries affected. Transect begins below major dam, so most sediment is trapped in reservoir.
Concentrated mining area with no mappable streams. At least 30 km of total streams affected, likely many more. Streams are tiny, mining completely alters hydrologic pathways.
Major mining area on first-order tributaries. Downstream-most section mappable.
Minor mining area with expansion since 2015. Not clearly much hydrologic impact. Mining may be abandoned as of 2020.
Steady expansion in tributaries to main stem from mid-1990s to present
Mining area including major pit mine. Mining is present at beginning of Landsat record. Mining appears to be largely limited from main river hydrologic effects, though tributaries are highly altered.
Tiny mining area along small stream.
Major mining area. Begins in early 1990s with major expansion in mid-1990s. Second major expansion in early 2010s, especially farther down the transect.
Major mining area with long history. Fully cleared a swath near small river headwaters. Mining extends up all tributaries to headwaters. Many unmapped river reaches. Major expansion in 2010s.
Mining area with major mining along main stem of river, some mining along first-order tributaries. Possibly began in 1990s but not sure. Major expansion in mid-2010s.
Headwater section of Cuyuni River mining. Long history of land clearance along river, but not certain it is mining until 2008. Major expansion in 2008.
Major headwater mining section of Cuyuni River mining. Mining begins in 1980s. Seady expansion after 2000.
Extremely remote mining area in Venezuela. Mid-2000s beginning and modest expansion. Not fully mined all the time. Stream marginal for Landsat mapping.

Extremely remote mining area in Venezuela. Mid-2000s beginning and modest expansion. Not fully mined all the time. Stream marginal for Landsat mapping. Stream intersects with larger stream from other headwater mining area.
Small mining area along main stem of Caroni River.
Small mining area.
Mining area in Venezuelan National Park. Active in the 1990s. Seems partially abandoned during the 2000s. Recent return in 2010s.
Mining district present in first Landsat images. Lull or halt in late 1990s and 2000s. Return and expansion in 2013.
Mining area along small tributary. Recent, only beginning in 2010. Not expanded much since.
Small mining area along Orinoco River. Limited hydrologic expression.
Small mining area along Orinoco River. Limited hydrologic expression.
Major pit mining in area as well. Dam in middle of transect completed 2015.
Mining operatons begin in late 1980s, seem to wane in 1990s and 2000s, then resume in 2012.

column34: 12 deaths, 4500 sick, and fish kill related to tailings pond leak: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/03/world/africa/mine-waste-angola-congo.html
column35: Catoca mine, mostly pit mining but with large tailings lake. Mining begins in mid-1990s. New mining area upstream in 2015. Lake failure and pollution in 2021.

Kimberlite diamond mining, prospecting stage. Small operation but some organization, run by ENDIAMA Mining. Begins in mid-2000s and steadily expands. Also large sustained headcut along river contributing to sediment loads.
Very small mining area in arid area west of Juba. Mining occurs in channel. Some other mining evident with more mechanized operations nearby, likely either for sand/gravel or oil.
Small mining area near town of Nzacko (also Nzako). Ebbs and flows over the years. May also have diamond mining.

Small mining area near Ituna-Itat preserve. Mining begins pre-Landsat. Seems to have resumed sometime in mid-2010s after a pause during late 1990s and 2000s. Major sediment plume evident in late 1980s into Xingu River.
Gold mining operations dispersed in relatively arid set of stream networks. Mining pits in and adjacent to stream. Major town expansion during 2010s coincides with more mining.
Gold mining operations in very small streams in British Columbia. Long history of mining likely dating to the 19th century gold rush, but increased activity since 2005.
Gold mining operations in very small streams in the Yukon Territory. Long history of mining likely dating to the 19th century gold rush, but continued recent activity.
Gold mining operations in very small streams in the Yukon Territory. Long history of mining likely dating to the 19th century gold rush, but increased activity in 2000s.
Small mining area in a small stream. New activity since 2005.
Several mining operations in floodplains, terraces, and mountain pits. Doesn't seem to have much surface water hydrologic connectivity.

Placer mining along Waikaia River. Began in 2014, ended in 20182019 with near-complete rehabilitation of vegetation. Very little if any connection with active river channel. Mining limited to floodplain/terrace sediment.
Small mining operation mostly in floodplain of creek, tributary to Waiau River. One of the more direct in-river operations in NZ. Began in 2010s.
Upper-most mining area in long river mining section of Awata River. Near large pit mine Lega Dembi, operational since late 1980s.
MB Gold Company Sarlu project along river. Began in 2015 with small operations. Mostly in floodplain with drainage to river. Also appears to be in-channel mining.
Followed logging roads, possibly loggers themselves.
Small individual mining area along river. Started in 2000s perhaps, though imagery is unclear.
Major pit mine with additional activity in the area. On small stream, dammed in 2005. Stream empties into Black Sea 10s of km downstream.
Major rutile mines. Some hyrdologic connection, mostly in estuary.
Mostly in-channel mining beginning in 2010s. Seems to be associated with plantations.
Long-standing daimond mining area. Seems to have diminished somewhat from peak activity in the 1980s.
Long-standing gold and copper mining district.

Enormous new complex of nickel mines. Began in 2008 and rapidly and consistently expanded to present. Very high environmental impact, little to no mitigation evident. Frather upstream in coastal wtershed than most nickel mines in Indonesia and Phillippines.
Coastal nickel mining site with long history. Recent expansion.
Combinaion of major pit mines and neaby artisanal and small-scale mies in channels. Pit mines seem mostly disconnected from hydrologoic system but notenitrely clear.
Recent mining with long downstream effect. Begins in late 2010s.
Lower section of major mining area in small river. Begins in 2010 and rapidly expands.
